\hypertarget{classaurora_1_1_hardware}{}\doxysection{aurora\+::Hardware Class Reference}
\label{classaurora_1_1_hardware}\index{aurora::Hardware@{aurora::Hardware}}


\mbox{\hyperlink{classaurora_1_1_hardware}{Hardware}} support class for the Qu-\/\+Bit Aurora This should be created, and intitialized at the beginning of any program before running anything else.  




\doxysubsection{Detailed Description}
\mbox{\hyperlink{classaurora_1_1_hardware}{Hardware}} support class for the Qu-\/\+Bit Aurora This should be created, and intitialized at the beginning of any program before running anything else. 

If you\textquotesingle{}ve used the Daisy Seed, etc. before this object takes the place of the core \char`\"{}\+Daisy\+Seed\char`\"{} or other board support objects. 

{\ttfamily \#include $<$aurora.\+h$>$}

\mbox{\Hypertarget{classaurora_1_1_hardware_aa1052faa54a363f9c84be71272fea7b1}\label{classaurora_1_1_hardware_aa1052faa54a363f9c84be71272fea7b1}} 
\index{aurora::Hardware@{aurora::Hardware}!ChangeSampleRate@{ChangeSampleRate}}
\index{ChangeSampleRate@{ChangeSampleRate}!aurora::Hardware@{aurora::Hardware}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{ChangeSampleRate()}{ChangeSampleRate()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily void aurora\+::\+Hardware\+::\+Change\+Sample\+Rate (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{int}]{sr }\end{DoxyParamCaption})\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [inline]}}



Updates the samplerate to one of the allowed target samplerates. This function stops the audio completely, and will cause clicks. 


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em sr} & target samplerate in Hz. Allowed values are 16000, 32000, 48000, 96000 any other value will fallback to 48k\+Hz \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\mbox{\Hypertarget{classaurora_1_1_hardware_a07069982db84a01fc8b9ecd11ab1cc6d}\label{classaurora_1_1_hardware_a07069982db84a01fc8b9ecd11ab1cc6d}} 
\index{aurora::Hardware@{aurora::Hardware}!ClearLeds@{ClearLeds}}
\index{ClearLeds@{ClearLeds}!aurora::Hardware@{aurora::Hardware}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{ClearLeds()}{ClearLeds()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily void aurora\+::\+Hardware\+::\+Clear\+Leds (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}{ }\end{DoxyParamCaption})\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [inline]}}



sets all RGB LEDs to off state This can be called from the top of wherever LEDs are periodically set or within the UI framework\textquotesingle{}s Canvas descriptor via the clear\+Function\+\_\+ function. 

\mbox{\Hypertarget{classaurora_1_1_hardware_a9704429136666cd1ef67b6385d20bf63}\label{classaurora_1_1_hardware_a9704429136666cd1ef67b6385d20bf63}}

\mbox{\Hypertarget{classaurora_1_1_hardware_abb0131cca6e4ccdaa6791aca1fb04c9b}\label{classaurora_1_1_hardware_abb0131cca6e4ccdaa6791aca1fb04c9b}} 
\index{aurora::Hardware@{aurora::Hardware}!DelayMs@{DelayMs}}
\index{DelayMs@{DelayMs}!aurora::Hardware@{aurora::Hardware}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{DelayMs()}{DelayMs()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily void aurora\+::\+Hardware\+::\+Delay\+Ms (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{size\+\_\+t}]{del }\end{DoxyParamCaption})\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [inline]}}



delay function; same as System\+::\+Delay(), and should not be called from any interrupt callbacks (Low\+Priority\+Callback/\+Audio\+Callback). 


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em del} & number of milliseconds to delay \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}

Fills an array with the offset data currently being used \mbox{\Hypertarget{classaurora_1_1_hardware_aa51dba9b46e67b772d5209709d3f7ff1}\label{classaurora_1_1_hardware_aa51dba9b46e67b772d5209709d3f7ff1}} 
\index{aurora::Hardware@{aurora::Hardware}!GetCvValue@{GetCvValue}}
\index{GetCvValue@{GetCvValue}!aurora::Hardware@{aurora::Hardware}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{GetCvValue()}{GetCvValue()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily float aurora\+::\+Hardware\+::\+Get\+Cv\+Value (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{int}]{cv\+\_\+idx }\end{DoxyParamCaption})\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [inline]}}



gets calibrated offset-\/adjusted CV Value from the hardware. 


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em cv\+\_\+idx} & index of the CV to read from. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
offset adjusted output (except for warp which is v/oct calibrated) 
\end{DoxyReturn}
\begin{DoxyNote}{Note}
when returning warp CV from this function it will be with no calibrated offset, and is identical to reading from the Analog\+Control itself. 
\end{DoxyNote}
